entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 13 at 9:58AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Possible Flash Flooding Friday night through Sunday... An active surface trough is anticipated to develop northeast of the territory by the end of the week. Flash flooding from this feature is possible as the trough lingers in the area Friday night through Sunday. Model solutions have been consistent in enhanced instability and moisture associated with the trough.

entry.summary: ...Hot temperatures, Gusty winds and low humidities Sunday and Monday... .Period of hot temperatures, very dry conditions, and gusty winds associated with a dry cold front late this weekend will elevate fire conditions to critical Sunday and Monday. This will increase fire spread for new and exisiting fires.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Scattered Thunderstorms Through Mid Evening, Some Strong... Scattered storms will continue to develop and track southeast across the area through the mid evening hours. Some will be strong, capable of 3/4 inch hail and wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph. Locally heavy downpours can also be expected. Seek shelter indoors should a storm near your location.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 9:13PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Giles, south central Summers and southwestern Monroe Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 913 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Red Sulphur Spring, or near Peterstown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.
